The drawing should not be scaled and must be read with all related documents and specifications. It is an instrument of service owned by Edgewood Solutions Inc. and cannot be modified or reproduced without permission.

images.summary: This image contains the 'OBC PLAN LEGEND', which provides information on fire ratings and travel distances. The legend includes symbols for 0 hour, 3/4 hour, 1 hour, 1-1/2 hour, and 2 hour fire ratings. It also indicates travel distance and fire hose travel distance. A note advises referring to floor plans for wall types that are load-bearing and require a fire resistance rating. This legend is essential for understanding the fire safety requirements and travel distances within the building.

images.summary: This detail illustrates the installation of self-adhering flashing tape around a window or door opening. The detail is labeled 'WINDOWS/DOORS - SELF ADHERING TAPE TYP. DETAIL' and is drawn at a scale of 1" = 1'-0". It specifies the use of 3M All Weather Self-Adhering Flashing Tape (8067) and a Tyvek Air Barrier. The Tyvek wraps back at a 45-degree angle, and the self-adhering tape is positioned behind the Tyvek, with instructions to turn up the tape 6 inches below the Tyvek. The tape and Tyvek are sealed over each other to ensure a weather-tight installation. This detail is crucial for preventing water infiltration around window and door openings.

images.summary: This image provides detailed construction assemblies for various interior wall partitions, roof, and floor systems. The wall assemblies include WS1, WS2, WS3, WS4, and WSF2, each specifying different configurations of gypsum board and wood studs. WSF2 is a suite demising wall with a 1-hour fire rating, incorporating type 'X' gypsum board, vapour barrier, and mineral wool insulation. The roof assembly R-1 features asphalt shingles, OSB sheathing, wood trusses, and blown-in insulation. Floor assemblies FC1 and FC2 describe slab-on-grade systems with concrete slabs, vapour barriers, and compacted fill. These assemblies provide essential details for constructing fire-rated walls, insulated roofs, and durable floor systems.

It includes door elevations labeled A, B, C, and D, with sizes ranging from 22"x80" to 72"x80". images.summary: This detail illustrates a thickened slab at a demising wall, highlighting key construction elements such as a vapour barrier, wood sill plate, and anchor bolts. The slab includes 2-15m continuous rebar in the footing and is designed to bear on undisturbed native soil or compacted fill. The wood sill plate is anchored to the concrete foundation with 1/2" diameter anchor bolts spaced at 48" on center. This detail ensures structural integrity and moisture protection at the foundation level.

images.summary: This ground floor plan, labeled as 'GROUND FLOOR PLAN' on sheet A201, provides a detailed layout of the building's ground floor. It includes dimensions for various rooms such as bedrooms (10'-0" x 11'-5"), living rooms (12'-4" x 14'-2"), kitchens (12'-4" x 9'-0"), dining rooms (10'-9" x 9'-0"), mechanical/laundry rooms (8'-7" x 4'-0"), foyers (6'-6" x 6'-8"), and bathrooms (5'-0" x 8'-0"). The plan also shows closets and engineered trusses, with notes on pre-engineered gable end roofs and downspouts for surface discharge. Section callouts '1/A201' and '2/A201' indicate connections to other views. Element callouts such as 'WS1' to 'WS10' identify specific wall sections. The plan is crucial for understanding the spatial arrangement and structural components of the ground floor.

images.summary: The roof plan on sheet A202 illustrates the roof structure, including dimensions and specific notes for construction. Key components include roof box vents, non-vented shingle ridge caps, valley flashing, and aluminum gutters. The plan emphasizes ensuring the roof truss manufacturer accommodates additional loads for solar and exterior mechanical systems. Section callouts '1/A202' and '2/A202' provide references to other views. This plan is essential for the construction and installation of the roofing system, detailing the layout and necessary components.

images.text_verbatim:
ROOF PLAN NOTES
1. SUPPLY AND MAINTAIN ON A DAILY BASIS ALL TEMPORARY FENCING, HOARDING, SIGNAGE AND OTHER SEPARATIONS REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN THE SAFETY OF THE PUBLIC AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO STORES AND SHOPS DURING WORK OF THIS CONTRACT. COORDINATE THESE PROTECTIVE MEASURES WITH THE OWNER AND INDIVIDUAL STORE AND SHOP OWNERS.
2. MAINTAIN A CLEAN AND ORDERLY SITE AT ALL TIMES. ALL DEBRIS AND EXCESS MATERIALS NOT REQUIRED SHALL BE CLEARED FROM ROOF TOP NIGHTLY. ANY MATERIALS STORED ON THE ROOF SHALL BE PROPERLY SECURED TO PREVENT UPLIFT.
3. MATERIALS THAT ARE STORED ON THE ROOF SHALL BE PLACED ON PROPER SLEEPERS TO PREVENT ANY DAMAGE TO THE INSTALLED ROOFING AND NOT TO IMPEDE THE INSTALLED ROOF WATER DRAINAGE.
4. COORDINATE WITH OWNER AREA(S) FOR TAR KETTLE LOCATION AND MATERIALS STORAGE. SUPPLY AND INSTALL PROTECTIVE MEASURES TO ENSURE THE GENERAL PUBLIC'S SAFETY.
5. COORDINATE WITH OWNER ANY STAGING OF WORK.
images.summary: The roof plan notes provide guidelines for maintaining safety and order during construction. Key instructions include supplying and maintaining temporary fencing and signage to ensure public safety, maintaining a clean site by clearing debris nightly, and securing materials stored on the roof to prevent uplift. Materials should be placed on proper sleepers to avoid damage to the roofing and ensure proper drainage. Coordination with the owner is required for tar kettle locations and staging of work. These notes are crucial for ensuring safety and efficiency during the roofing process.

images.summary: This section view shows a detailed wall section, including a 1/2" plywood baffle with 2x2 nailers, sheathing, and insulation extending to the underside of the roof. Prefinished aluminum flashing and continuous vented soffit are typical. The section includes a wall sconce and a 'FC2' concrete patio in front of the door. The top of the top plate is at 8'-1", and the slab is at 0'-0". Reinforcement includes 2-15m continuous rebar at the top of the wall and in the footing. A waterproof membrane and drainage board are applied to all exterior concrete walls. A typical 4" diameter weeping tile with a minimum 6" clear stone cover and geo textile fabric is specified as per OBC 9.14. All foundations must bear on undisturbed native soil or compacted fill approved by a geotechnical engineer. This section is part of sheet A400, with a scale of 3/8" = 1'-0".

images.summary: This section view, labeled 'Long Building Section - Wall Section 1', illustrates a detailed vertical cut through a wall assembly. The section includes a 1-hour rated assembly with multiple layers of 5/8" Type 'X' gypsum board and girder trusses. The top of the wall is sealed with a vapor barrier, and fire caulking is applied at the roof sheathing joint. The top plate is at 8'-1", and the slab is at 0'-0". The wall is anchored with a 2x6" wood sill plate to a concrete foundation using 1/2" diameter anchor bolts spaced at 48" on center. Continuous 15m rebar is used in the footing. The foundation is designed to bear on undisturbed native soil or compacted fill, as approved by a geotechnical engineer. Key components include gypsum board, girder truss, wood sill plate, concrete foundation, and rebar. Section callouts '4/A500' and '1/A200' indicate related views.

It includes a vapour barrier, a 2x6" wood sill plate with a minimum 3" bearing anchored to a concrete foundation using 1/2" diameter anchor bolts at 48" on center. The detail specifies the installation of a sill gasket, 6" x 6" x 6/6 welded wire mesh, and continuous rebar at the top of the wall. Additional components include a lap and seal air/water barrier, weep vents, and a prefinished thru-wall black poly flashing. The top of the slab is at 0'-0". The drawing scale is 1 1/2" = 1'-0".

The top plate and fire blocking are shown, with the fire blocking required to be a minimum of 38mm thick lumber. The interior wall is non-load bearing and non-rated, indicating it does not contribute to the structural integrity or fire resistance of the building.

images.text_verbatim:
PENETRATIONS IN FIRE SEPARATIONS - PLAN DETAIL - TYPICAL
1ST DWELLING UNIT
2ND DWELLING UNIT
NONCOMBUSTIBLE PIPING TIGHTLY FITTED
ELECTRICAL WIRING WITH COMBUSTIBLE INSULATION PERMITTED NOT MORE THAN 25mm IN DIAMETER
COMBUSTIBLE ELECTRICAL OUTLET BOXES PERMITTED IF NOT MORE THAN 160cm²
COMBUSTIBLE VACUUM & DRAINAGE PIPING TIGHTLY FITTED WITH LISTED FIRESTOP SYSTEM AS PER ULC-S115
COMBUSTIBLE WATER PIPING PERMITTED IF NOT MORE THAN 30mm IN DIAMETER
FIRE SEPARATION (FLOOR OR WALL ASSEMBLY)
O.B.C. 9.10.9.6
images.summary: This plan detail shows typical penetrations in fire separations between dwelling units. It includes noncombustible piping tightly fitted, electrical wiring with combustible insulation permitted up to 25mm in diameter, and combustible electrical outlet boxes allowed if not more than 160cm². Combustible vacuum and drainage piping must be tightly fitted with a listed firestop system as per ULC-S115. Combustible water piping is permitted if not more than 30mm in diameter. The section callout '1/A500' references this detail in the drawing set.

images.text_verbatim:
FIRE BLOCKING NOTES
PERMITTED FIRE BLOCKING MATERIALS (O.B.C. - 9.10.16.3 (2))
• 0.38mm SHEET STEEL
• 12.7mm GYPSUM BOARD
• 12.5mm PLYWOOD, OSB OR WAFERBOARD, WITH JOINTS HAVING CONTINUOUS SUPPORTS
• 2 LAYERS OF 19mm LUMBER WITH JOINTS STAGGERED
• 38mm LUMBER
FIRE BLOCKING EXEMPTION FOR WALLS (O.B.C. - 9.10.16.2 (2))
• NO BLOCKING IS REQUIRED IN WALLS WHERE THE WALL IS INSULATED AND INSULATION IS SUPPORTED FROM MOVING IN THE CAVITY
PENETRATIONS (O.B.C. - 9.10.16.4)
• PENETRATIONS FOR WIRES AND PIPING BETWEEN HORIZONTAL AND VERTICAL SPACES ARE REQUIRED TO BE FIRE AND SMOKE SEALED
images.summary: These notes provide specifications for fire blocking materials and exemptions. Permitted materials include 0.38mm sheet steel, 12.7mm gypsum board, 12.5mm plywood, OSB or waferboard with continuous support joints, and 38mm lumber. Fire blocking is exempt in walls where insulation is supported from moving. Penetrations for wires and piping must be fire and smoke sealed, according to O.B.C. 9.10.16.4.

The fire-rated floor assembly is continuous, while the non-fire-rated option includes a concealed space. The top plate requires fire blocking with a minimum of 38mm thick lumber. A minimum of 12.7mm gypsum board must be installed prior to the bulkhead. The section callout '2/A500' references this detail in the drawing set.
